about.title: Mission & Vision
about.contentMission: ADiT-Lab’s mission is to contribute to the advancement of regional, national and international knowledge with a focus on digital transformation for sustainability. Based on a multidisciplinary group of researchers, ADiT-Lab will contribute to 4 fundamental objectives: improving the quality of life of citizens, the digital preservation of cultural heritage, the improvement of organizational processes and the reduction of the ecological footprint. To this end, the group will count on the competences and skills of researchers in the area of information and communication technologies and electronics, as well as complementary knowledge from researchers in areas such as tourism, health, education, design, among others.
about.contentVision: ADiT-Lab intends to become, until 2025, a research center recognized by the Portuguese Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) as well as asserting itself as a national reference in the area of digital transformation for sustainability, with substantial scientific production andprojects in the area. It also intends to start building its presence on theinternational scientific network now, so that in 2030 it will have that sameconsolidated presence, with several foreign partners with whom it has jointscientific publications as well as international projects.

researchAreasDetails.title: Intelligent Environments
researchAreasDetails.name: Intelligent Environments
researchAreasDetails.content: Intelligent Environments (IE) result from the harmonious integration of information and communication technologies (ICT) with the physical world, where networked sensors, actuators, and controllers are blended together with ubiquitous computing to foster interaction with the user and its immediate surroundings, to enhance the user experience.
researchAreasDetails.content2: This thematic line is a crucial topic on digital transformation and constitutes a promising source for business innovation towards sustainability, which may include, not only the design of more sustainable products, but also the introduction of new disruptive services, and business models. The development of such environments typically includes several layers, like sensing/actuation, networking, reasoning, security & privacy, and human interaction, demanding for a multidisciplinary team with traversal competencies in several technology fields, such as the Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Ubiquitous & Mobile Computing (UMC), Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) and Cybersecurity. This blend of competencies paves the way for innovation with the aim of enhancing peoples' life in more sustainable environments such as cities, buildings, factories, campi, hospitals, etc.

researchAreasDetails.title: Interactive Media
researchAreasDetails.name: Interactive Media
researchAreasDetails.content: The main objective of the Interactive Media thematic area is the development of interactive systems, technologies and media contents, most suitable to the interests and needs of a person or an organization, enhancing the best experience on using them.
researchAreasDetails.content2: The main interests of the ADiT researchers, in result of the experience accumulated over the years, includes the development for Virtual, Augmented and Mixed Reality, Geographic Information Systems, Serious Games, Digital Technologies for Education, Computer Vision, Information Visualization and Interactive Systems, with application in three main areas: Digital Cultural Heritage, Health and Education, contributing to promote the well-being of all, and thus ensuring the inclusive and sustainable growth of society.

researchAreasDetails.title: Organizational Proccesses
researchAreasDetails.name: Organizational Proccesses
researchAreasDetails.content: Organizational Processes involves all the activities that aggregate value to products and services along the supply chain of the organizations. Efficient management of materials, information and financial flows work on improving the organization's economic, social and environmental sustainability.
researchAreasDetails.content2: In ADiT-LAB, the Organizational Processes research area deals with logistics and supply chain performance evaluation; traceability in value and supply chains; digitalization of industry and organizations towards circular value chains; integrating business processes for circular economy and sustainability; sustainable mobility practices; design and performance evaluation of industrial and services systems.
researchAreasDetails.content3: Multidisciplinary research is pursued under a sustainable systems approach, suitable to address the challenges of Industry 4.0.
